column1: #Text=Morenci is a copper-mining town in Eastern Arizona .
#Text=Morenci and neighboring Clifton share a common history of copper mining , and are today commonly referred to as the Clifton-Morenci district .
#Text=Copper was discovered in Morenci in 1872 and mining began the following year .
#Text=Both towns have had a cyclical history of booms and busts , and today downtown Clifton is nearly abandoned , with most economic activity centered in Morenci .
#Text=Geronimo is said to have been born near the current site of Clifton , and well-known southwest impressionist artist Ettore DeGrazia was born in Morenci .
#Text=The only direct access to Morenci and Clifton is via US Highway 191 , aka the Coronado Trail , considered to be the least-traveled federal highway in the US .
#Text=The closest town of any size is Safford , which is about a 45-minute drive to the southeast .
#Text=There is no public transportation , so it essential to have your own car .
#Text=Operational since 1881 , the Morenci Mine is the largest open pit copper mine in the US and one of the largest in the world .
#Text=Tours of the working mine provide a fascinating glimpse of the mining process .
#Text=Visitors are paired with retired miners from the community .
#Text=Tours last 2.5 hours and depart from the Morenci Motel .
#Text=$ 7 ( seniors ) , $ 4 ( youths 9-17 ) ; children under 9 not permitted ; group rates offered .
#Text=This spot provides a unique vantage point for the mining operation .
#Text=A small museum dedicated to the mining history of Clifton and Morenci .
#Text=Rock hunting in Limestone Canyon ( Limestone Gulch ) ( northeast of Clifton ) .
#Text=Limeston Canyon has extensive deposits of agate , red jasper , and rhyolite .
#Text=Mares Bluff , Ward Canyon Rd ( trailhead ) ( south of Clifton ) .
#Text=This steep but short trail leads to a good view of Clifton and the peaks and gulleys of the surrounding area .
#Text=The trail was constructed as a veterans memorial , with numerous plaques lining the path .
#Text=Plan on about half an hour for the round trip hike .
#Text=Chase Creek Marketplace , 215 Chase Creek St ( Clifton ) , ☏ +1 928-865-1251 , ✉ chasecreek@vtc.net .
#Text=A small shop with locally-made handcrafted gifts .
#Text=Morenci and Clifton are not known for haute cuisine , although it is possible to get a decent meal here .
#Text=Miners Diner , 106 Plaza Loop ( Bashas ' Shopping Center ) , ☏ +1 928-865-2213 .
#Text=Copper Room Restaurant and Lounge , 261 Burro Alley ( in the Morenci Motel ) , ☏ +1 928-865-4111 .
#Text=R & R Pizza Express , 9 Morenci Mall ( off of Hwy 191 ) , ☏ +1 928-865-2200 .
#Text=The only pizza place in town , with an all-you-can-eat lunch buffet .
#Text=There are just a few options in town for accommodation .
#Text=, 30 Coronado Blvd , Clifton ( off of Hwy 191 ) , ☏ +1 928-865-4536 , ✉ clifton@rodeinnmotels.com .
#Text=North Clifton RV Park , 380 Frisco Ave ( Clifton ) , ☏ +1 928-865-9064 , toll-free : +1 928-865-4472 , ✉ NorthCliftonRVPark@cableone.net .
#Text=Full hook-ups for RVs , with sites for tents .
#Text=Laundry facilities , showers , toilets , limited free Wi-Fi .
